field_body.value:
EPA has posted for public comment four draft technical documents supporting state and tribal adoption and implementation of EPA's 2016 Clean Water Act section 304(a) selenium criterion. These documents assist states and authorized tribes in adopting the new selenium criterion, monitoring fish tissue, assessing and listing waters under CWA section 303(d), and National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System permitting. The 2016 national recommended aquatic life criterion for selenium in freshwater reflects the latest scientific information, which indicates that toxicity to aquatic life is driven by dietary exposures. EPA recommends states and authorized tribes adopt the selenium criterion into their water quality standards.

The public comment period closes on December 12, 2016.

For more information - including the draft documents and how to comment - click the link below:

    Aquatic Life Criterion - Selenium: Draft Technical Support Materials for Aquatic Life Criterion for Selenium - Freshwater 2016

The 2016 national recommended aquatic life criterion for selenium in freshwater reflects the latest scientific information, which indicates that toxicity to aquatic life is driven by dietary exposures. EPA recommends states and authorized tribes adopt the selenium criterion into their water quality standards.
